result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Reimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in full by 07-25-2022 or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig A Reimer

records.addlTxt:
02:07 PM Defendant Craig A Reimer in court with attorney Jeffrey John Ek. Both appear by video.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid within 60 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Authorization to Appear filed by Atty. Jeffrey Ek
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:51 AM Defendant Craig A Reimer in court with attorney Jeffrey John Ek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State has offer to amend charge. Defense has provided confirmation for completion of community service. Defendant permitted to appear by Zoom for next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed by Atty. Jeffrey Ek
